data.approach: Create a RecoveryWidget in the TopBar that detects recoverable sessions by cross-referencing: 1) Tasks in in_progress status with an assignee, 2) .claude/sessions/agent-{sessionId}.txt files mapping to agent names, 3) No active tmux session jat-{agentName}. Widget shows count badge, allows batch or individual recovery. Recovery calls existing /api/sessions/[name]/resume endpoint.

suggestedTasks.title: Implement Session Recovery Widget for Top Bar
suggestedTasks.description:
Design and develop a persistent session recovery component that appears when interrupted sessions are detected. The widget should:
- Automatically detect lost/interrupted tmux sessions
- Provide one-click restoration of previous session states
- Include visual indicators for session status (recoverable/non-recoverable)
- Work across different agent environments and task types
suggestedTasks.reason: Critical user experience improvement for handling system crashes

suggestedTasks.title: Create Persistent Session State Management Protocol
suggestedTasks.description:
Develop a robust mechanism for tracking and preserving agent session states, including:
- Periodic state snapshots
- Crash-resistant state storage
- Automatic session recovery logic
- Minimal performance overhead
suggestedTasks.reason: Prevent data loss and improve system resilience during unexpected shutdowns
